position.name: position
position.appliesTo: all elements except table-column-group and table-column

top.name: top
top.percentages: refer to size of containing block; see prose
top.computedValue: the keyword auto or a computed <length-percentage> value

right.name: right
right.percentages: refer to size of containing block; see prose
right.computedValue: the keyword auto or a computed <length-percentage> value

bottom.name: bottom
bottom.percentages: refer to size of containing block; see prose
bottom.computedValue: the keyword auto or a computed <length-percentage> value

left.name: left
left.percentages: refer to size of containing block; see prose
left.computedValue: the keyword auto or a computed <length-percentage> value

inset-block-start.name: inset-block-start
inset-block-start.percentages: refer to size of containing block; see prose
inset-block-start.computedValue: the keyword auto or a computed <length-percentage> value

inset-inline-start.name: inset-inline-start
inset-inline-start.percentages: refer to size of containing block; see prose
inset-inline-start.computedValue: the keyword auto or a computed <length-percentage> value

inset-block-end.name: inset-block-end
inset-block-end.percentages: refer to size of containing block; see prose
inset-block-end.computedValue: the keyword auto or a computed <length-percentage> value

inset-inline-end.name: inset-inline-end
inset-inline-end.percentages: refer to size of containing block; see prose
inset-inline-end.computedValue: the keyword auto or a computed <length-percentage> value

<length>.prose: The inset is a fixed distance from the reference edge. Negative values are allowed.

<percentage>.prose: The inset is a percentage relative to the containing block’s size in the corresponding axis (e.g. width for left or right, height for top and bottom). For sticky positioned boxes, the inset is instead relative to the relevant scrollport’s size. Negative values are allowed.
